descriptionMarkdown:
This is a fully automated Kovarex processor, using logic circuits and an S-R Latch to recycle and add materials as necessary to keep the process flowing, while outputting excess u-235 for use.  

Turning on the Red Constant Cobinator will halt production.  Setting the value for the L Constant Combinator will set the limit for the chest storing u-235 produced in excess of the 40 required for the process to continue.  To start, deposit 40 u-235 into the centrigue and 5 u-238, and stock the chest supplying u-238.  You must keep the u-238 chest stocked to continue the fully automatic process.  The filtered stack inserter placing u-235 on the input belt must be set to a factor of 40 (i.e., 1, 2,4,5,8 or 10).  The filtered inserter placing replacement u-238 onto the input belt must be set to a stack size of 3.

The control circuitry utilizes an S-R latch to insure that the process output feeds 40 u-235 back into the centrifuge and any additional u-235 into a provider chest.  In addition, the control circuitry feeds the two u-238 products back into the centrifuge and adds three more for the process to continue.  Finally, the control circuitry will set lights to blue when processing is occurring, green when output is occurring, and red when processing is stopped (either manually through the red constant combinator or when the u-235 provider chest reaches the limit set by the L constant combinator).  The L constant combinator is set to an initial value of 500, although this can be changed.

You tile the print left to right, or use the reverse function to place two side-by-side.
title: Fully Automated Kovarex, Tileable and Beaconed
